Class SongTemplate

java.lang.Object
  SongTemplate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<SongTemplate>
public class SongTemplate
extends Object
implements Comparable<SongTemplate>

Partially completed class to represent a song for the Song Database.

It contains accessor and any mutator methods for the expected fields (i.e. instance variables) within a song record. It also contains a group of constants which are intended to be used to determine the result of sorting or matching songs.

This file should be copied as Song.java and then modified to provide the implementation.

(do not forget to change any occurrence of SongTemplate, within the Song.java copy, to Song)

matches

public boolean matches(int matchMode,
                       String matchValue)
Matches this song against a given title, artist or genre, depending on the given match mode, which may be as a substring or exact. (note: there is no match for url/timesPlayed)

Parameters:
matchMode - match mode to use
matchValue - match value to use (either exact or substring, depending on matchMode)
Returns:
true if and only if song matches matchValue with respect to matchMode

setSortMode

public static void setSortMode(int requiredSortMode)
Sets the sort mode to use in future comparisons. This should be over-ridden in an implementation.

Parameters:
requiredSortMode - required sort mode

compareTo

public int compareTo(SongTemplate other)
Modify to Implement Comparable interface, to give a total ordering on SongTemplate objects, but dependent upon the current sort mode. (note: consistent equals() and hashCode() methods should be implemented.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable<SongTemplate>
Parameters:
other - the object to be compared
Returns:
-ve if this is less than (<) other, 0 if this is equal to other, +ve if this is greater than (>) other
